Actions.Name: Discard check out
Actions.Description: If you check out a file and dont make changes to it, or you make changes that you dont want to keep, you can simply discard the checkout, rather than saving the file. If your organization tracks versions, a new version is created each time you check a file back into the library. By discarding the checkout, you can avoid making new versions when you havent made any changes to the file.

Actions.Description: Get all lists and libraries.

Actions.Description: Gets file contents using the file identifier. The contents can be copied somewhere else, or be used as an attachment.

Actions.Name: Get file content using path
Actions.Description: Gets file contents using the file path.

Actions.Name: Get file properties
Actions.Description:
Gets the properties saved in the columns in the library for the item specified by the item id.
You can add a "Get file content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.
When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

Actions.Name: Get files (properties only)
Actions.Description:
Gets the properties saved in the columns in the library for all folders and files stored in the library.
You can also filter down to the items that match a condition. An "Apply to each" section is usually used to work with the output from this action.
When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

Actions.Name: Get file metadata
Actions.Description: Gets information about the file such as size, etag, created date, etc. Uses a file identifier to pick the file. Use "Get file properties" action to get to the values stored in the columns in the library.

Actions.Name: Get file metadata using path
Actions.Description: Gets information about the file such as size, etag, created date, etc. Uses a file path to pick the file. Use "Get file properties" action to get to the values stored in the columns in the library.

Actions.Name: Get folder metadata
Actions.Description: Gets information about the folder. Uses a file identifier to pick the folder.

Actions.Name: Get folder metadata using path
Actions.Description: Gets information about the folder. Uses a folder path to pick the folder.

Actions.Name: Get item
Actions.Description: Gets a single item by its id from a SharePoint list.

Actions.Name: Get attachments
Actions.Description: Returns the list of attachments for the specified list item. You can add a "Get attachment content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.

Actions.Name: Get changes for an item or a file (properties only)
Actions.Description: Returns information about columns that have changed within a given time window. Note: The list must have Versioning turned on.

Actions.Name: Get items
Actions.Description: Gets items from a SharePoint list.

Actions.Description: Triggers when an item is modified (but not when it is created).

Actions.Description: Triggers when a file is deleted in a library. You can optionally specify a folder to watch as well. When a folder is deleted, the trigger will fire only once for the deleted folder. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.

Actions.Name: When an item is deleted
Actions.Description: Triggers when an item is deleted in a list. This can only be used by site collection admins of the site where the list is located.

Actions.Name: When a file is created (properties only)
Actions.Description:
Triggers when an item is created in a library. Returns only the properties stored in the library columns.
You can add a "Get file content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.
When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

Actions.Description: Triggers when an item is created.

Actions.Name: When a file is classified by a content understanding model
Actions.Description: Triggers when a SharePoint Syntex content understanding model classifies a file, shown in the classification date property of the file.

Actions.Name: When a file is created or modified (properties only)
Actions.Description:
Triggers when an item is created, or modified in a library. Returns only the properties stored in the library columns.
You can add a "Get file content" step and use the "File identifier" property returned by this action to get to the contents of the file.
When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

Actions.Description: Moves a folder. Works in a similar way to the "Move to" command in SharePoint libraries. Returns information about the new folder after move.

Actions.Name: Set hub site join status to pending
Actions.Description: Set the requested site's hub join request status to pending. The Approval Correlation Id is an optional parameter that helps SharePoint identify a particular hub join request. The requesting site can only have one pending request at a given time.

Actions.Name: For a selected file
Actions.Description: This trigger allows you to start a flow for a selected file. Inputs: Site Address, Library Name. Outputs: Name, Link to Item, ID. (Available only for Power Automate.)

Actions.Name: When a site has requested to join a hub site
Actions.Description: Triggers a flow upon hub site join approval. (Available only for Power Automate.)

Actions.Name: For a selected item
Actions.Description: This trigger allows you to start a flow for a selected item in a SharePoint list or library. You can use the columns of the list or library as output parameters. For a file, you can use the "identifier" column to get file content. (Available only for Power Automate.)

Actions.Name: When a file is created in a folder
Actions.Description: Triggers when a file is created in a SharePoint folder. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

Actions.Name: When a file is created or modified in a folder
Actions.Description: Triggers when a file is created, and also each time it is modified in a SharePoint folder. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

Actions.Name: Update file properties
Actions.Description:
Updates the properties stored in columns in a library for the item specified by the item id. Use "Update file" action to update file contents.
When using this with the On-Premises Data Gateway, the name of the library to connect to may need to be entered manually.

Actions.Name: Update file properties using AI Builder model results
Actions.Description: Updates the values stored in library columns for a file analyzed by the model specified by the ModelId.

Actions.Name: Update item
Actions.Description: Updates an item in a SharePoint list.

Actions.Name: Create item
Actions.Description: Creates a new item in a SharePoint list.

Actions.Name: Resolve person
Actions.Description: Returns a single matching user value so it can be assigned to a column of type person. If there are no matches, or multiple matches, this action will error out.

Actions.Name: Set content approval status
Actions.Description: Sets the content approval status for an item in a list or library that has content approval turned on. You must provide an ETag for pages and files. You can get the ETag using the Get File Metadata action. This action is only available for SharePoint Online and SharePoint 2019.

Actions.Name: Stop sharing an item or a file
Actions.Description: Delete all links giving access to an item or a file and remove all people with direct access except for owners.

Actions.Name: Update file
Actions.Description: Updates the contents of the file specified by the file identifier.

Actions.Description: The API returns a list of general named entities in a given document. For the list of supported entity types, check Supported Entity Types in Text Analytics API. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

Actions.Name: Key Phrases (V3.0)
Actions.Description: The API returns a list of strings denoting the key phrases in the input text. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

Actions.Name: Detect Language (V3.0)
Actions.Description: The API returns the detected language and a numeric score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

Actions.Name: Sentiment (V3.0)
Actions.Description: The API returns a sentiment prediction, as well as sentiment scores for each sentiment class (Positive, Negative, and Neutral) for the document and each sentence within it. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.
